alert.note: Alert for Brazoria; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 6:18PM CST until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River near Boling affecting Brazoria, Fort Bend and Wharton Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River near Boling. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding continues with significant backwater flooding up Peach Creek and minor backwater flooding up West Bernard Creek in Wharton County. Backwater flooding up Snake Creek threatens low lying areas in the Tierra Grande subdivision. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 18.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 PM CST Wednesday was 18.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall Sunday morning. It will rise to 19.2 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.9 feet on 01/25/2007. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat San Bernard River Boling 18.0 18.2 Wed 5 pm CST 24.0 21.0 19.1 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by tomorrow morning.Thursday afternoon at 1230 PM CST.
